content: mimic is designed with a wavy fan pattern that ripples out from the center towards either edge in a mirror image it s a quick make with a captivating self-shading yarn which we know you ll love is this top too good to be true or simply the next treasured pattern in your queue you ll have to make it to find out **skill** crochet **difficulty** easy **sizes** extra small small medium large 1x 2x 3x 4x 5x shown in extra small size with approx 2 of negative ease **finished measurements** chest 30¼ 33¾ 37¼ 41 44½ 48 51½ 55 58¾ length 17¼ 17½ 17¼ 19¼ 19¼ 19¼ 21½ 21½ 21½ **materials** **universal yarn** *sandcastle* 1 46% cotton 43% linen 11% silk 50g/115 yds 105 driftwood 5 6 7 7 8 9 10 10 11 skeins hook us size g/6 4 mm or size needed to obtain gauge notions tapestry needle **gauge** 19 sts x 9 row = 4 in pattern save time check your gauge **pattern notes** this top is constructed with two identical halves which are then seamed together with slip stitches to create a visible seam each half starts with making two small panels which are both joined to continue adding width for the shoulders each half is then seamed in the center to create a front and back then is seamed up the sides of each edge to create the top please note that size 4x makes the most of 10 skeins of sandcastle you may wish to purchase an extra skein of yarn as insurance this pattern uses us crochet terminology 1 https //universalyarn com/products/sandcastle
